allow-docker-update.description: Whether the Calico framework is allowed to reconfigure and restart Docker on the Mesos Agent to install Docker with multi-host networking.  Note that during restart, the agent will not be available, and tasks running on the agent will be lost.

max-concurrent-restarts.description: The maximum number of Agent or Docker restarts that are allowed to be scheduled concurrently by the Calico framework.

zk.description: The URL of Zookeeper to be used to persist Calico framework data. The format is a comma-delimited list of hosts like zk://host1:port,host2:port/calico, including the trailing path.

cpu-limit-framework.description: The CPU shares for the Calico framework.

mem-limit-framework.description: Memory limit (MB) for the Calico framework.

cpu-limit-install.description: The CPU shares for each install task instance.

mem-limit-install.description: Memory limit (MB) for each install task instance.

cpu-limit-etcd-proxy.description: The CPU shares for each etcd proxy instance.

mem-limit-etcd-proxy.description: Memory limit (MB) for each etcd proxy instance.

cpu-limit-node.description: The CPU shares for each Calico node instance.

mem-limit-node.description: Memory limit (MB) for each Calico node instance.

cpu-limit-libnetwork.description: The CPU shares for each Calico Docker Network driver instance.

mem-limit-libnetwork.description: Memory limit (MB) for each Calico Docker Network driver instance.

status-dns.description: The DNS name used to resolve the Calico status web page.

etcd-discovery-url.description: The etcd service discovery URL used to determine the addresses of the full etcd cluster.

master.description: The URL of the Mesos master. The format is a comma-delimited list of hosts like zk://host1:port,host2:port/mesos. If using ZooKeeper, pay particular attention to the leading zk:// and trailing /mesos! If not using ZooKeeper, standard host:port patterns, like localhost:5050 or 10.0.0.5:5050,10.0.0.6:5050, are also acceptable.

cni-plugins-dir.description: Location of CNI plugins on the Agent.

resource-overrides.description: Override resources. Note: If your cluster does not have WAN and you are pre-fetching resources.json, Calico will be unable to download these files.

node-image.description: Override the node image specified in resources.json

installer-url.description: Override the URL for the installer binary.

framework-image.description: Override the docker image for the calico-dcos framework.
